page.title: 13Local History-S.E.Sheffield
page.content: The area has always been a boundary area even in roman times.Boundary between Mercia and Northumbria.Viking boundary of the Scarsdale Wapentake along the White Lane ridge.Now boundary between Yorkshire and Derbyshire. {Placenames} {Basegreen}-has been associated with the area for centuries -mentioned in Parliamentery survey 1640.Basegreen Common,Basegreen Farm on White Lane. {Frecheville}-name chosen by H.Boot. The Frechevilles of Staveley owned land on Birley Moor.Frecheville -new estate - or "Fresh"- high,exposed. {Gleadless}-a glead was a form of hawk that was in evidence in the area. 'Less' was a clearing in a wood.The school badge has a Hawk,a Yorkshire Rose and an Oak tree, within a shield.
